children.title: Ratios and Unit Rates
children.teaser: Investigate and relate ratios, rates, and percents, applying reasoning in real world problem solving.

children.title: Representing and Reasoning About Ratios
children.teaser: Students understand ratios as a multiplicative comparison of two or more numbers.

children.title: Ratios
children.teaser: Students learn ratio language and notation.

children.title: Ratios (Continued)
children.teaser: Students continue to learn and use language and notation of ratios.

children.title: Equivalent Ratios
children.teaser: Students explore, solve, and define equivalent ratios.

children.title: Equivalent Ratios (Continued)
children.teaser: Students solve problems involving equivalent ratios.

children.title: Solving Problems by Finding Equivalent Ratios
children.teaser: Students use tape diagrams to solve equivalent ratio problems.

children.title: Solving Problems by Finding Equivalent Ratios (Continued)
children.teaser: Students continue to use tape diagrams to solve equivalent ratio problems.

children.title: Associated Ratios and the Value of a Ratio
children.teaser: Students understand the relationship between ratios and fractions.

children.title: Equivalent Ratios Defined Through the Value of a Ratio
children.teaser: Students use the value of a ratio to solve problems in a real-world context.

children.title: Collections of Equivalent Ratios
children.teaser: Students explore collections of equivalent ratios in real-world contexts.

children.title: Tables of Equivalent Ratios
children.teaser: Students explore ratio tables and use them to solve problems.

children.title: The Structure of Ratio Tables—Additive and Multiplicative
children.teaser: Students use the additive and multiplicative structure of a ratio table.

children.title: Comparing Ratios Using Ratio Tables
children.teaser: Students solve problems by comparing different ratios.

children.title: From Ratio Tables to Double Number Line Diagrams
children.teaser: Students create equivalent ratios using a ratio table.

children.title: From Ratio Tables to Equations Using the Value of the Ratio
children.teaser: Students restate a ratio in terms of its value.

children.title: From Ratio Tables, Equations, and Double Number Line Diagrams to Plots on the Coordinate Plane
children.teaser: Students represent ratios in ratio tables, equations, and double number line diagrams.

children.title: A Synthesis of Representations of Equivalent Ratio Collections
children.teaser: Students work on a variety of ratio problems using multiple representations to answer questions.

children.title: Unit Rates
children.teaser: Students understand how ratio relationships correspond to unit rate.

children.title: From Ratios to Rates
children.teaser: Students learn to associate a ratio of two quantities to another quantity called the rate.

children.title: From Rates to Ratios
children.teaser: Given a rate, students find associated ratios.

children.title: Finding a Rate by Dividing Two Quantities
children.teaser: Students learn to interpret and model a rate as a division of two quantities.

children.title: Comparison Shopping—Unit Price and Related Measurement Conversions
children.teaser: Students solve problems by analyzing different unit rates.

children.title: Comparison Shopping—Unit Price and Related Measurement Conversions (Continued)
children.teaser: Students continue to solve problems by analyzing different unit rates.

children.title: Getting the Job Done—Speed, Work, and Measurement Units
children.teaser: Students use rates between measurements to convert measurement.

children.title: Getting the Job Done—Speed, Work, and Measurement Units (Continued)
children.teaser: Students decontextualize a given speed situation.

children.title: Problem Solving Using Rates, Unit Rates, and Conversions
children.teaser: Students solve constant rate problems.

children.title: Percent
children.teaser: Students are introduced to percent and find percent of a quantity as a rate per 100.

children.title: Percent and Rates per 100
children.teaser: Students relate percents to ratios and rates, and learn to model and write percents.

children.title: A Fraction as a Percent
children.teaser: Students write a fraction and a decimal as a percent and vice versa.

children.title: Percent of a Quantity
children.teaser: Students find the percent of a quantity.

children.title: Solving Percent Problems
children.teaser: Students find the percent of a quantity, and solve problems involving finding the whole.

children.title: Solving Percent Problems (Continued...)
children.teaser: Given a part and the percent, students find the percent and the whole.

children.title: Solving Percent Problems (Continued...)
children.teaser: Students continue solving percent problems using various methods to solve.

children.title: Arithmetic Operations Including Division of Fractions
children.teaser: Students expand their understanding of the number system and build their fluency in arithmetic operations.

children.title: Dividing Fractions by Fractions
children.teaser: Students determine quotients through visual models, bar diagrams, tape diagrams, arrays, and number line diagrams.

children.title: Interpreting Division of a Fraction by a Whole Number—Visual Models
children.teaser: Students use visual models to represent division.

children.title: Interpreting Division of a Whole Number by a Fraction—Visual Models
children.teaser: Students continue exploring the division and multiplication of fractions.

children.title: Interpreting and Computing Division of a Fraction by a Fraction—More Models
children.teaser: Students use visual models to show the division of fractions by fractions.

children.title: Interpreting and Computing Division of a Fraction by a Fraction—More Models (Continued)
children.teaser: Students use visual models to divide fractions by fractions with different denominators.

children.title: Creating Division Stories
children.teaser: Students demonstrate further understanding of division of fractions by creating their own word problems.

children.title: More Division Stories
children.teaser: Students create their own fraction division word problems.

children.title: The Relationship Between Visual Fraction Models and Equations
children.teaser: Students formally connect models of fractions to multiplication.

children.title: Dividing Fractions and Mixed Numbers
children.teaser: Students divide fractions by mixed numbers.

children.title: Multi-Digit Decimal Operations—Adding, Subtracting, and Multiplying
children.teaser: Students connect distributive property to decimal operations and use estimation to justify their answer.

children.title: Sums and Differences of Decimals
children.teaser: Students find the sums and differences of decimals.

children.title: The Distributive Property and the Products of Decimals
children.teaser: Students apply the distributive property to find the product of decimals.

children.title: Fraction Multiplication and the Products of Decimals
children.teaser: Students determine placement of the decimal point in products, and relate fraction and decimal multiplication.

children.title: Dividing Whole Numbers and Decimals
children.teaser: Students connect estimation to place value and gain deeper conceptual understanding of the standard algorithm.

children.title: Estimating Digits in a Quotient
children.teaser: Students determine the standard algorithm for division.

children.title: Dividing Multi-Digit Numbers Using the Algorithm
children.teaser: Students understand that the standard algorithm of division is a tally system.

children.title: The Division Algorithm—Converting Decimal Division into Whole Number Division Using Fractions
children.teaser: Students divide multi-digit numbers with and without remainders.

children.title: The Division Algorithm—Converting Decimal Division into Whole Number Division Using Mental Math
children.teaser: Students solve for quotients of multi-digit decimals.

children.title: Number Theory—Thinking Logically About Multiplicative Arithmetic
children.teaser: Students think logically about multiplicative arithmetic.

children.title: Even and Odd Numbers
children.teaser: Students understand factors and multiples.

children.title: Divisibility Tests for 3 and 9
children.teaser: Students apply divisibility rules to understand factors and multiples.

children.title: Least Common Multiple and Greatest Common Factor
children.teaser: Students find the least common multiple and greatest common factor.

children.title: The Euclidean Algorithm as an Application of the Long Division Algorithm
children.teaser: Students explore Euclid’s Algorithm in finding the greatest common factor of larger numbers.

children.title: Rational Numbers
children.teaser: Students understand rational numbers as points on the number line.

children.title: Understanding Positive and Negative Numbers on the Number Line
children.teaser: Students explore the number line in the opposite direction (to the left or below zero).

children.title: Positive and Negative Numbers on the Number Line—Opposite Direction and Value
children.teaser: Students extend understanding of the number line to the right and left of zero.

children.title: Real-World Positive and Negative Numbers and Zero
children.teaser: Students use positive integers to locate negative integers on the number line.

children.title: Real-World Positive and Negative Numbers and Zero (Continued)
children.teaser: Students use positive and negative numbers to indicate a change in quantities.

children.title: The Opposite of a Number
children.teaser: Students understand that each nonzero integer has an opposite on the other side of zero.

children.title: The Opposite of a Number's Opposite
children.teaser: Students locate and position opposite numbers on a number line.

children.title: Rational Numbers on the Number Line
children.teaser: Students explore positive and negative integers and rational numbers on number lines.

children.title: Order and Absolute Value
children.teaser: Students apply understanding of a rational number’s position on the number line to order rational numbers

children.title: Ordering Integers and Other Rational Numbers
children.teaser: Students write, interpret, and explain statements of order for rational numbers in the real-world.

children.title: Ordering Integers and Other Rational Numbers (Continued)
children.teaser: Students order rational numbers.

children.title: Comparing Integers and Other Rational Numbers
children.teaser: Students compare and interpret rational numbers’ order on the number line.

children.title: Writing and Interpreting Inequality Statements Involving Rational Numbers
children.teaser: Students write and explain inequality statements involving rational numbers.

children.title: Absolute Value—Magnitude and Distance
children.teaser: Students understand the absolute value of a number.

children.title: The Relationship Between Absolute Value and Order
children.teaser: Students understand how the order of absolute values differs between positive and negative numbers.

children.title: Statements of Order in the Real World
children.teaser: Students apply understanding of order and absolute value when examining real world scenarios.

children.title: Rational Numbers and the Coordinate Plane
children.teaser: Students extend their understanding of the number line to the two-dimensional space of the coordinate plane.

children.title: Ordered Pairs
children.teaser: Students explore ordered pairs on a grid.

children.title: Locating Ordered Pairs on the Coordinate Plane
children.teaser: Students extend their understanding of the coordinate plane to all four quadrants.

children.title: Symmetry in the Coordinate Plane
children.teaser: Students recognize the relationship that exists between points on the coordinate plane.

children.title: Drawing the Coordinate Plane and Points on the Plane
children.teaser: Students draw a coordinate plane on graph paper.

children.title: Distance on the Coordinate Plane
children.teaser: Students compute the length of horizontal and vertical line segments using absolute value.

children.title: Problem Solving and the Coordinate Plane
children.teaser: Students use the coordinate plane to graph various items.

children.title: Expressions and Equations
children.teaser: Students begin formal study of algebraic expressions and equations.

children.title: Relationships of the Operations
children.teaser: Students understand the relationships of operations.

children.title: The Relationship of Addition and Subtraction
children.teaser: Students build and clarify the relationship of addition and subtraction.

children.title: The Relationship of Multiplication and Division
children.teaser: Students build and clarify the relationship of multiplication and division.

children.title: The Relationship of Multiplication and Addition
children.teaser: Students build and clarify the relationship of multiplication and addition.

children.title: The Relationship of Division and Subtraction
children.teaser: Students build and clarify the relationship of division and subtraction.

children.title: Special Notations of Operations
children.teaser: Students write and evaluate numerical expressions with whole number exponents.

children.title: Exponents
children.teaser: Students are introduced to exponents.

children.title: The Order of Operations
children.teaser: Students evaluate numerical expressions.

children.title: Replacing Letters and Numbers
children.teaser: Students understand that a letter in an expression represents a number.

children.title: Replacing Letters with Numbers
children.teaser: Students learn about numbers replacing letters in expressions.

children.title: Replacing Numbers with Letters
children.teaser: Students learn about numbers being replaced by letters in expressions.

children.title: Expanding, Factoring, and Distributing Expressions
children.teaser: Students become comfortable with new notations of multiplication and division.

children.title: Writing Addition and Subtraction Expressions
children.teaser: Students write expressions that record addition and subtraction operations with numbers.

children.title: Writing and Expanding Multiplication Expressions
children.teaser: Students identify parts of an expression.

children.title: Factoring Expressions
children.teaser: Students model and write equivalent expressions in factored form.

children.title: Distributing Expressions
children.teaser: Students model and write equivalent expressions in expanded form.

children.title: Writing Division Expressions
children.teaser: Students rewrite division problems as fractions

children.title: Writing Division Expressions (Continued)
children.teaser: Students write numerical expressions in two forms and note the relationship between the two.

children.title: Expressing Operations in Algebraic Form
children.teaser: Students express operations in algebraic form.

children.title: Read Expressions in Which Letters Stand for Numbers
children.teaser: Students read expressions in which letters stand for numbers.

children.title: Write Expressions in Which Letters Stand for Numbers
children.teaser: Students write algebraic expressions that record all operations.

children.title: Write Expressions in Which Letters Stand for Numbers (Continued)
children.teaser: Given verbal expressions, students write algebraic expressions that record all operations.

children.title: Writing and Evaluating Expressions and Formulas
children.teaser: Students use variables to write expressions and generate formulas.

children.title: Writing and Evaluating Expressions—Addition and Subtraction
children.teaser: Students use variables to write expressions involving addition and subtraction from real-world problems.

children.title: Substituting to Evaluate Addition and Subtraction Expressions
children.teaser: Students develop expressions involving addition and subtraction from real-world problems.

children.title: Writing and Evaluating Expressions—Multiplication and Division
children.teaser: Students develop expressions involving multiplication and division from real-world problems.

children.title: Writing and Evaluating Expressions—Multiplication and Addition
children.teaser: Students develop formulas involving multiplication and addition from real-world problems.

children.title: Writing and Evaluating Expressions—Exponents
children.teaser: Students evaluate and write formulas involving exponents for given values in real-world problems.

children.title: Solving Equations
children.teaser: Students solve equations by determining the number(s) that, when substituted for the variable, result in a true sentence.

children.title: True and False Number Sentences
children.teaser: Students determine if a number sentence is true or false based on the given symbol.

children.title: True and False Number Sentences (Continued)
children.teaser: Students identify values for the variable in an equation and inequalities that result.

children.title: Finding Solutions to Make Equations True
children.teaser: Students learn the definition of solution.

children.title: One-Step Equations—Addition and Subtraction
children.teaser: Students solve one-step, addition and subtraction equations by relating an equation to a diagram.

children.title: One-Step Equations—Multiplication and Division
children.teaser: Students solve one-step, multiplication and division equations by relating an equation to a diagram.

children.title: Two-Step Problems—All Operations
children.teaser: Students calculate the solution of two-step equations.

children.title: Multi-Step Problems—All Operations
children.teaser: Students calculate the solution of multi-step equations.

children.title: Applications of Equations
children.teaser: Students solve equations in real-world, contextual problems.

children.title: One-Step Problems in the Real World
children.teaser: Students calculate missing angle measures by writing and solving equations.

children.title: Problems in Mathematical Terms
children.teaser: Students construct tables of independent and dependent values in order to analyze equations.

children.title: Multi-Step Problems in the Real World
children.teaser: Students analyze an equation in two variables and make a graph.

children.title: From Equations to Inequalities
children.teaser: Students explore solving inequalities.

children.title: Writing and Graphing Inequalities in Real-World Problems
children.teaser: Students recognize that inequalities can have infinitely many solutions.

children.title: Area, Surface Area, and Volume Problems
children.teaser: Students apply their understanding of expressions and equations to solve for unknowns area, surface area, and volume.

children.title: Area of Triangles, Quadrilaterals, and Polygons
children.teaser: Students construct/ deconstruct quadrilaterals and polygons into triangles or rectangles in order to determine area.

children.title: The Area of Parallelograms Through Rectangle Facts
children.teaser: Students show the area formula for the region bounded by a parallelogram.

children.title: The Area of Right Triangles
children.teaser: Students justify the area formula for a right triangle.

children.title: The Area of Acute Triangles Using Height and Base
children.teaser: Students determine if the area formula for right triangles is the same for acute triangles.

children.title: The Area of All Triangles Using Height and Base
children.teaser: Students discover why the area formula 1/2 bh works for all triangles.

children.title: The Area of Polygons Through Composition and Decomposition
children.teaser: Students show the area formula for the region bounded by a polygon.

children.title: Area in the Real World
children.teaser: Students find areas of composite figures in real-life contexts.

children.title: Polygons on the Coordinate Plane
children.teaser: Students draw polygons on the coordinate plane and calculate area and perimeter.

children.title: Distance on the Coordinate Plane
children.teaser: Students determine distance between integers on the coordinate plane to find side lengths of polygons.

children.title: Drawing Polygons in the Coordinate Plane
children.teaser: Students draw polygons in the coordinate plane and find the area enclosed by them.

children.title: Determining Perimeter and Area of Polygons on the Coordinate Plane
children.teaser: Students find the perimeter of irregular figures and the area enclosed by polygons.

children.title: Distance, Perimeter, and Area in the Real World
children.teaser: Students determine distance, perimeter, and area in real-world contexts.

children.title: Volume of Right Rectangular Prisms
children.teaser: Students conceptualize finding the volume of a right rectangular prism with fractional edge lengths.

children.title: Volume with Fractional Edge Lengths and Unit Cubes
children.teaser: Students extend their understanding of volume to right rectangular prisms with fractional side lengths.

children.title: From Unit Cubes to the Formulas for Volume
children.teaser: Students extend the volume formula for a right rectangular prism.

children.title: The Formulas for Volume
children.teaser: Students explore formulas for finding the volume of right rectangular prisms and cubes.

children.title: Volume in the Real World
children.teaser: Students apply volume formulas to determine the volume of composite solid figures.

children.title: Nets and Surface Area
children.teaser: Students note the difference between finding volume versus surface area of right rectangular prisms.

children.title: Representing Three-Dimensional Figures Using Nets
children.teaser: Students construct three-dimensional figures through the use of nets.

children.title: Constructing Nets
children.teaser: Students construct nets of three-dimensional objects using the measurements of a solid’s edges.

children.title: From Nets to Surface Area
children.teaser: Students use nets to determine the surface area of three-dimensional figures.

children.title: Determining Surface Area of Three-Dimensional Figures
children.teaser: Students determine the surface area of a right rectangular prism.

children.title: Surface Area and Volume in the Real World
children.teaser: Students  choose appropriate formulas to solve real-life volume and surface area problems.

children.title: Applying Surface Area and Volume to Aquariums (Optional)
children.teaser: Students apply the formulas for surface area and volume to determine dimensions of aquariums.

children.title: Statistics
children.teaser: Students begin to think and reason statistically.

children.title: Understanding Distributions
children.teaser: Students recognize a statistical question as one that can be answered by collecting data.

children.title: Posing Statistical Questions
children.teaser: Students recognize statistical questions and think about what data could be collected to answer them.

children.title: Displaying a Data Distribution
children.teaser: Students begin describing the distribution of the points on the dot plot.

children.title: Creating a Dot Plot
children.teaser: Students create a dot plot.

children.title: Creating a Histogram
children.teaser: Students construct a frequency histogram.

children.title: Describing a Distribution Displayed in a Histogram
children.teaser: Students learn the shape of a histogram does not change when constructed using relative frequency.

children.title: Summarizing a Distribution that is Approximately Symmetric Using the Mean and Mean Absolute Deviation
children.teaser: Students study quantitative ways to summarize numerical data sets .

children.title: Describing the Center of a Distribution Using the Mean
children.teaser: Students learn to calculate the mean.

children.title: The Mean as a Balance Point
children.teaser: Students characterize the mean in the sense of a balance point, and calculate deviations.

children.title: Variability in a Data Distribution
children.teaser: Students compare data sets to evaluate various characteristics of data distribution.

children.title: The Mean Absolute Deviation (MAD)
children.teaser: Students calculate the mean absolute deviation (MAD) for a given data set.

children.title: Describing Distributions Using the Mean and MAD
children.teaser: Students calculate the mean and MAD for a data distribution.

children.title: Describing Distributions Using the Mean and MAD (Continued)
children.teaser: Students use the mean and MAD to describe and compare data distributions.

children.title: Summarizing a Distribution that is Skewed Using the Median and the Interquartile Range
children.teaser: Students summarize data sets in relation to their context and the shape of the distribution.

children.title: Describing the Center of a Distribution Using the Median
children.teaser: Given a data set, students calculate the median of the data.

children.title: Describing Variability Using the Interquartile Range (IQR)
children.teaser: Students calculate the median and describe the variability in the data.

children.title: Summarizing a Distribution Using a Box Plot
children.teaser: Students construct a box plot from a given set of data.

children.title: More Practice with Box Plots
children.teaser: Students summarize data in a box plot, and create a box plot from a summary.

children.title: Understanding Box Plots
children.teaser: Students summarize a data set using box plots, the median, and the interquartile range.

children.title: Summarizing and Describing Distributions
children.teaser: Students state a statistical question, collect and analyze data, and interpret results as related to their question.

children.title: Developing a Statistical Project
children.teaser: Students construct a statistical question  and answer the question.

children.title: Connecting Graphical Representations and Numerical Summaries
children.teaser: Students match the graphical representations and numerical summaries of a distribution.

children.title: Comparing Data Distributions
children.teaser: Students compare and contrast the box plots of at least two data sets.

children.title: Describing Center, Variability, and Shape of a Data Distribution from a Graphical Representation
children.teaser: Given a frequency histogram, students can describe the data collected.

children.title: Summarizing a Data Distribution by Describing Center, Variability, and Shape
children.teaser: Given a data set, students can describe the data collected.

children.title: Presenting a Summary of a Statistical Project
children.teaser: Students communicate conclusions based on a data distribution.
